summary: This document is a chain of emails from June-July 2019 among FBI personnel and others coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show logistical planning for a call scheduled for June 28, 2019, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time, involving the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force and Victim Services Division.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: An unclassified conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case, involving FBI personnel from the Violent Crimes Task Force and Victim Services Division.

events.title: ADIC case brief request
events.description: The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case brief on the Epstein case for Monday at 3:30 PM, requiring a hard stop at 3:20 PM for the scheduled meeting.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating victim interviews in the Epstein case as of June-July 2019.
A conference call involving the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force and Victim Services Division was scheduled for June 28, 2019, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time.
The emails indicate involvement of Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs) from the FBI's Victim Services Division.
The document shows internal FBI logistical planning and communication regarding the Epstein investigation.
